meta.title: COVID 19 UPDATES/INFORMATION - Regional School District #12

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection329 fsHasTheme3

li.a: This is the Connecticut State Department of Education's supports for families.
CCMC's link for helping students cope during COVID.

ul.li: Please remember that our shutdown is an effort to slow and reduce the spread of COVID-19. The district encourages you and your student to avoid large crowds and practice social distancing. Our shutdown is only successful if families comply with the governor’s recommendations.
We ask that you contact our main office number (860) 868-6100 if you or your child show symptoms of having COVID-19.
Region 12 phone lines are covered throughout the day, and we are available for any questions. The main number for Region 12 Schools is (860) 868-6100.

Our support services providers, including counselors and psychologists, are remotely accessible if you or your child needs help in coping with the stress and anxiety regarding COVID-19. You are welcome to reach out to Michael Boucher at (860) 868-6219 or boucherm@region-12.org to schedule a time to speak to a support service provider.
Please note that students may be exposed to false information on social media. You can refer to this simple, stick-to-the-facts article to help your conversation about COVID-19 with your child.

li.a: Need wifi and having trouble paying for it? (or know someone who does?)

h2.a: Need wifi and having trouble paying for it? (or know someone who does?)

div.p: Free Spectrum broadband and WiFi access for 60 days in home with K-12 and/or college students that don’t have an existing Spectrum service level up to 100 Mbps. Installation fees will be waived for new student households and the company said those interested should call 1-844-488-8395.

em.b: Acceso gratuito a banda ancha y WiFi de Spectrum durante 60 días en el hogar con estudiantes de K-12 y / o universitarios que no tienen un nivel de servicio de Spectrum existente de hasta 100 Mbps. Las tarifas de instalación no se aplicarán a los nuevos hogares de estudiantes y la compañía dijo que los interesados ​​deben llamar al 1-844-488-8395.

div.div: Families can qualify for free wifi services through COMCAST or call 1-855-846-8376.

em.strong: Las familias pueden calificar para servicios wifi gratuitos a través de COMCAST o llamar al 1-855-and 1-855-765-6995 en Espanol.

span.span: EdAdvance Food Service is offering meals for students in need during school shutdown.

strong.span: Any child under 18 is eligible to pick up a grab and go meal at the designated times. The meal will include lunch for that day and breakfast for the next.

span.span: Any family can go to the designated pick up location. Meals will be provided at two locations in the area,

starting on Monday, March 16, 2020. Meals will be provided in a drive-thru fashion at both sites Monday through Friday 11:30 am – 1:00 pm. Any child 18 or under will be provided a Grab and Go bag lunch for that day and a breakfast for the next morning.

strong.span: However, if you WOULD LIKE TO PICKUP YOUR LUNCH AT SHEPAUG, PLEASE EMAIL NICOLE GRANT TO ARRANGE DETAILS at grantn@region-12.org

p.b: EdAdvance Food Service ofrece comidas para estudiantes necesitados durante el cierre de la escuela. Cualquier niño menor de 18 años es elegible para recoger una comida para llevar en las horas designadas. La comida incluirá almuerzo para ese día y desayuno para el siguiente. Cualquier familia puede ir al lugar de recogida designado. Las comidas se proporcionarán en dos ubicaciones en el área, la Escuela Vogel-Wetmore en Torrington y la Escuela Intermedia Pearson en Winchester a partir del lunes 16 de marzo de 2020. Las comidas se proporcionarán de manera ambulante en ambos sitios de lunes a viernes 11: 30 am - 1:00 pm. A cualquier niño de 18 años o menor se le proporcionará una bolsa de almuerzo Grab and Go para ese día y un desayuno para la mañana siguiente.

span.b: Sin embargo, si DESEA RECOGER SU ALMUERZO EN SHEPAUG, ENVÍE POR CORREO ELECTRÓNICO A NICOLE Grant para organizar los detalles en grantn@region-12.org

ul.li: Are you in a financial tight spot? The Selectmen's Fund is available for any Washington resident in financial distress. Please contact MaryAnne Green at 860-868-2259 maryanne.greene@washingtonct.org ¿Estás en una situación financiera difícil? El Selectmen's Fund está disponible para cualquier residente de Washington en dificultades financieras. Póngase en contacto con MaryAnne Green al 860-868-2259 maryanne.greene@washingtonct.org

The Digital Branch is your 24 hours a day, 7 days a week access to thousands of different eBooks, eAudio, streaming television, movies, and music, all from the comfort of your home. All you need to unlock these amazing services is your library card. Click the images below to access these great services.
Curbside pickup for item requests available. Call 973-584-2400 to make requests, inquiries, and more.
Digital Library is open 24/7. FIND OUR MORE HERE.

li.div: Need a library card? Contact Martie by email gunncirc@biblio.org or by phone 860-248-9420! She'll give you a card number you can use online, and when the library re-opens she'll print the card for you.
As we all try to navigate the situation surrounding the COVID-19 outbreak, we would like to remind you about the services we have currently have available, especially for families:

Curbside Pickup - call in generic requests for book selections for certain age groups; we will gather materials and meet you at your car when you pick them up. Or request a specific title(s), we’ll check the shelves and deliver curbside.
Craft Kits, Nature Day Packs, and Adventure Suitcases are available for curbside pickup, too.
Our Kids Digital Resource Page has a host of links for kids to encourage reading and learning
Overdrive/Libby App - Our digital library is full of materials available at your fingertips. *You can set a filter to show you only available titles!

GUNN MEMORIAL LIBRARY is considering the option of hosting VIRTUAL STORY TIMES using video conferencing software. Please follow the link below and complete the survey so we can determine how to provide the best service we can in the midst of these unusual circumstances. ttps://www.surveymonkey.com/r/VLXKNFL

div.b: During and after this unprecedented break from school, the SVS Humanities Department will be publishing a special Coronavirus Edition of the Spartan Chronicle.
Write an article, journal entry, poem, or short story about your experiences during this historic time
Create memes, videos, or photos that show or say something about what you and we are experiencing
Collect quotes or interview friends and family
Find another way to collect, chronicle, share, or interpret this experience
Check out https://thespartanchronicle.org/ to see the content that we already have, but don’t be constrained by what others have done.
When we return to school we’ll have a pizza party celebration and maybe some prizes for anyone who contributes.
Submit your entries to Mr. Croft at croftm@region-12.org and to Spartan Chronicle advisor Mrs. Pitt at pittb@region-12.org.
Please share your questions and ideas, too

div.p: SATs and Smarter Balanced Assessments (SBA) will have a longer testing window to allow for proper testing administration. We have asked clarification on AP testing requirements.

span.strong: Click button below for Families First Coronavirus Response Act

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
